name: Small Appliance Hardware Test Plan
description: Automated electrical measurements for small appliances: motor current, heating element resistance, power consumption, safety ground continuity, leakage current
safetyWarnings: Ensure GFCI protection is active before energizing any appliance
Do NOT touch probes or test points while appliance is energized
Unplug appliance before measuring resistance or continuity
Use insulated probes rated for AC mains voltage

steps.name: Safety Ground Continuity
steps.description: Measure resistance between chassis/ground pin and exposed metal parts. Must be < 1 ohm for safety certification.
steps.setupInstructions: Unplug appliance. Connect multimeter probes: one to ground pin of power plug, other to any exposed metal surface on the appliance chassis.

steps.name: Heating Element Resistance
steps.description: Measure resistance of heating element. Open circuit (infinite) indicates burned-out element. Short circuit indicates damaged element.
steps.setupInstructions: Unplug appliance. Disconnect heating element leads if accessible, or measure across plug prongs with thermostat bypassed.

steps.name: AC Power Consumption
steps.description: Measure power draw under normal operating conditions. Compare to rated wattage on nameplate.
steps.setupInstructions: Connect appliance through AC power meter (Kill-A-Watt or inline meter). Turn on appliance to normal operating mode.

steps.name: Motor Current Draw
steps.description: Measure AC current drawn by the motor during operation. Excessive current indicates bearing wear or motor winding issues.
steps.setupInstructions: Clamp current clamp around one conductor of the power cord (separate hot wire). Turn on appliance to normal operating mode.

steps.name: Leakage Current Test
steps.description: Measure leakage current between live conductor and chassis ground. Must be < 0.5mA for Class I appliances (IEC 60335).
steps.setupInstructions: Use a leakage current adapter or sensitive current clamp on the ground conductor. Appliance must be energized and operating.
